description:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players will help shape our great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.

Our Hardware Strategic Relationships and Deals team focuses on the strategic relationships and agreements that enable the growth and success of Google’s Hardware business. The team partners with our business and cross-functional leaders to develop relationship and engagement strategy, lead the agreement-making process, and develop and maintain ongoing relationships with external partners.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Only one thing consistently stands in the way between our users and the world's information - hardware. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of experience in agreement and contract management, business development, banking, or legal counsel, negotiating business terms and conditions in agreements, and performing agreement project management.
  • Ability to travel up to 15% of the time.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in project management and management of cross-functional teams.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment. Ability to thrive and succeed in ambiguity.
  • Ability to understand the business objectives of an agreement and to independently identify and triage the impact and urgency of agreement issues.
  • Ability to work effectively with external stakeholders.
  • Ability to be customer-service oriented, have great attention to detail, and easily switch gears with excellent organization skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Work directly with both internal partners and external parties to draft, review, and/or consult on a range of commercial and technology agreements, including procurement agreements, project schedules, Statement of Work (SOWs), technology/software licensing agreements, and development agreements.
  • Drive the entire lifecycle of an agreement, including partnering with cross-functional stakeholders in preparation, implementation, and management.
  • Support Strategic Relationship and Deals team members on major projects and initiatives.
  • Provide agreement related issue resolution, including post-agreement tracking.
title: Strategic Deals Associate, Consumer Hardware
